page.title: 04YATE AMBULANCE STATION
page.content: The ambulance station in Yate covers 180 square miles.At the end of 1985 the ambulance station will be much bigger and they will get a new ambulance.They have got two emergency ambulances one of them is called the front line which is the main one and the other one which is a follow up is called the second line.They have got 8 men which are fully trained and they have got 3 men which are not yet trained and they drive the tail lift buses.1200 patients were carried in the ambulance last month(June 1985)80 were 999 or emergency calls,6 maternities,130 were taken ill and 950 were non iurgent routine.The average mileage per month is 8300 miles and they use 520 gallons of petrol and 6 pints of oil and it all costs about Â£1000 pounds.The ambulance station is about 30 years old.
